response.answer_text: There’s something kinda ironic about writing an article reviewing the top product review sites, am I right? But anyways, here are the top product review sites, organized by their worldwide Alexa rankings and verified by their Moz domain authority rankings. I’ve been researching social media management platforms lately and found Capterra, G2 Crowd, and GetApp to be really helpful. PC Mag also posts reviews, which I’ve used in the past, but I find user reviews to be the most helpful when trying to decide between solutions. Users will give you a straight answer and really dig into all the minor annoyances, favorite features, etc. because they use the tools on a daily basis. A few awesome features you’ll find on those three review sites are: G2 Crowd’s G2 Grid, which maps out all of the different software options in one grid by leaders, high performers, contenders, and niche solutions (based on user reviews). It’s also a great way to see all of your options in one place rather than running a Google search and sorting through several software review articles.Being able to filter solutions by different factors like price, star rating, etc. I like being able to easily look at the negative reviews to see why a user disliked a solution. I have to say, though, some of the negative reviews lack depth. These sites claim to have strict guidelines for reviews, but I’m surprised a few of the reviews were approved.A quick view into the Pros and Cons of each solution.A rundown of the feature set for each solution, which is often scattered about on vendor sites.
